meanings.sent1: The boat was stuck, so they used a towrope to pull it to shore.
meanings.sent2: The towrope was strong enough to pull the car out of the ditch.
meanings.sent3: The towrope looked like a long snake slithering through the water.
meanings.sent4: With the towrope in hand, they were able to rescue the stranded hikers.
meanings.sent5: The bright color of the towrope made it easy to spot in the dark.

meanings.definition: To pull or haul with a towrope.
meanings.sent1: They had to towrope the broken-down car back to the garage.
meanings.sent2: He carefully towroped the heavy load across the field.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to towrope their little brother on his skateboard for fun.
meanings.sent4: She towroped the luggage up the stairs with great effort.
meanings.sent5: The team had to towrope the equipment up the steep mountain slope.
